mentionedBy.name: Unity Software Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Leading open-source alternative. Free and available under MIT license. Cross-platform engine for both 2D and 3D games. Supports C++, C#, and GDScript. Known for intuitive node-based hierarchy. Popular among indie developers and small studios.

mentionedBy.name: Unity Software Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Leading open-source alternative. Free under MIT license. Released in 2014 by Juan Linietsky and Ariel Manzur. Supports both 2D and 3D development. Uses GDScript (Python-like) and C#. Lightweight engine popular for rapid prototyping. Growing steadily in popularity among indie developers and small teams due to flexibility and affordability.

mentionedBy.name: Unity Software Inc.
mentionedBy.notes: Best open-source alternative. Free under MIT license. Created by Juan Linietsky and Ariel Manzur (2014). Versatile environment for 2D and 3D games. Node-based architecture for simplified development. Rapidly growing community. Increasingly popular for indie, hobbyist, and professional projects. User-friendly and intuitive design.
